place.name: REDHILL
place.gazetteerText: REDHILL, a hamlet in Wrington parish, Somerset; 2 miles E of Wrington village. It has a chapel of ease, built in 1844; and it ranks as a chapelry, annexed to therectory of Wrington, in the diocese of Bath and Wells. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
